meanings.definition: The act of disposing or arranging again.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the redisposition of the furniture was necessary.
meanings.sent2: The redisposition of the books on the shelf made them easier to find.
meanings.sent3: The redisposition of the toys in the room led to a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her redisposition of the flowers in the vase created a beautiful arrangement.
meanings.sent5: The redisposition of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.

meanings.definition: A predisposition that has been arranged again.
meanings.sent1: His redisposition to always be early for meetings impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The redisposition of her thoughts towards positivity improved her outlook on life.
meanings.sent3: The redisposition of his taste buds from sweet to savory was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her redisposition to trust easily was a result of past experiences.
meanings.sent5: The redisposition of his emotions after the movie left him feeling inspired.
